is stepping down as CEO of Google, and Larry Page is taking over the company just announced in target="_blank" href="http://investor.google.com/earnings/2010/Q4_google_earnings.html"> its earnings release. Eric Schmidt will become Executive Chairman focused on, deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, the company says. Google's other cofounder, Sergey Brin will take a more active role in strategic projects including product. The change is effective starting April 4, 2011.

similar tack on a question that came to haunt the Bush administration: Why didn't the Pentagon dispatch more troops to Iraq at the outset, rather than Donald Rumsfeld 's preferred option of a light and agile force?
